io.s4.zeno.monitor
Class EventRateLoadMonitor

java.lang.Object
  io.s4.zeno.monitor.EventRateLoadMonitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventMonitor, LoadMonitor
public class EventRateLoadMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
implements LoadMonitor, EventMonitor

Load monitoring based on the rate at which events arrive and the amount of time taken to process each event. The measure of resource usage is the fraction of wall-clock time spent on processing events.

If events arrive at the rate of r per second and, on an average, processing an event takes s seconds (wall-clock), then the fraction of wall clock time spent processing events is defined as B = r*s. This quantity can be greater than 1 in the case of multi-core machines.

This time fraction is represented as a TimeSliceResource. Two thresholds: eventHigh and eventLow are used to decide if the load level is Low (B < eventLow), High (B > eventHigh), or Medium (eventLow <= B <= eventHigh).

Two other thresholds, accept and shed, are used to determine the free resources and excess resource utilization. 

     excessResorce = max {B-shed, 0}
     freeResource  = max {accept-B, 0}

Constructor Detail

EventRateLoadMonitor

public EventRateLoadMonitor(int halfLife,
                            double eventLow,
                            double eventHigh)
Monitor with load level thresholds. This is identical to EventRateLoadMonitor(halfLife, eventLow, eventHigh, 1.0, 0.75, 0.85)

Parameters:
halfLife - half life for the rate estimator. See PoissonEventMonitor
eventLow - low load threshold
eventHigh - high load threshold
See Also:
EventRateLoadMonitor(int, double, double, double, double, double)

EventRateLoadMonitor

public EventRateLoadMonitor(int halfLife,
                            double eventLow,
                            double eventHigh,
                            double capacity,
                            double a,
                            double s)
Monitor with load level and resource availability thresholds.

Parameters:
halfLife - half life for the rate estimator. See PoissonEventMonitor
eventLow - low load threshold
eventHigh - high load threshold
capacity - wall-clock time fraction capacity. This is typically set to be equal to the number of available processor cores; in a 1 second interval, a node with N cores can process events whose cumulative processing time is up to N seconds.
a - fraction of capacity to be used as accept threshold.
s - fraction of capacity to be used as shed threshold.

EventRateLoadMonitor

public EventRateLoadMonitor(ConfigMap spec)
Initialize from a config map. The following fields from the config map are used as parameters to EventRateLoadMonitor(int, double, double, double, double, double) : 
     "monitor.halfLife"   halfLife
     "monitor.low"        eventLow
     "monitor.high"       eventHigh
     "resource.capacity"  capacity
     "resource.accept"    a
     "resource.shed"      s

Parameters:
spec - config map to initialize from

waitForSilence

public void waitForSilence(long silenceMs,
                           long timeoutMs)
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                           java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
Description copied from interface: EventMonitor
Wait for a period of silence. Blocks till a period of time passes without any events. Times out after a specified period.

Specified by:
waitForSilence in interface EventMonitor
Parameters:
silenceMs - period of time for which silence should be observed (milliseconds).
timeoutMs - timeout (milliseconds).
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting.
java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if timeout expired.
